p.s: The given excerpt from chapter 5 of The Great Gatsby, published in 1995 by F. Scott Fitzgerald is about the first reunion of Daisy and Gatsby after almost five years.
In the beginning Daisy asks Nick Carraway, the narrator, if he was in love with her and why she had to come alone.
Nick doesn't answer this question directly and says, that it is a secret.
After that he makes sure that Daisy's chaffeur won't interrupt.
Nick and Daisy go inside, where Nick wants Daisy to meet Gatsby.
Meanwhile Gatsby went outside in the rain, just to knock on the door again.
After they went into the living room, there is not much talking.
Then, while Gatsby tries to do some smalltalk, he destroys NicksNick's clock, but repairs it immediatlyimmediately.
Daisy says, that she and Gatsby have not mer for many years.
Gatsby answers, that it will be five years next November.
After there is a silent minute again, Nick leaves the house to let both of them enjoy their time together.
Before he can leave, Gatsby follows him to talk for a moment.
He tells Nick, what a terrible mistake all this is.
Nick calms him down and goes outside.
While waiting, he watches Gatsby's house.
After half an hour, when it stopped raining, Nick goes back inside.
He tries to get their attention, by making loud noises, but they did not hear them because they were so focused on each other.
He tells Gatsby, that it stopped raining, to indicate, that they could go to Gatsby's house now.
Gatsby realizes and asks Nick and Daisy to come over.
